chargeHist.descr: Possess cocaine w/Intent to deliver as repeater (>5-15g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J. HOWARD was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program after serving the first 18 months of initial confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

No association with any known drug users or gang members.

Follow all rules of community supervision.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

superTimeConds.notes: Complete 400 hours of community service during the term of extended supervision.

ARRAIGNMENT 
Information charges 1 ct. Possess Cocaine with Intent to Deliver as Repeater, contrary to Section 961.41(1m)(cm)2 & 961.48(1)(b) of the Wisconsin Statutes and 1 ct.
